rows.translation: Ta Sin Mim.

bismillah.translation: In the name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful.

rows.translation: These are the verses of the Book that makes (things) clear.

rows.arabic: لَعَلَّكَ بَـٰخِعٌ نَّفْسَكَ أَلَّا يَكُونُوا۟ مُؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: Perhaps you will kill yourself with grief because they do not believe.
rows.transliteration: la`allaka bākhi`un nafsaka allā yakūnū mu-minīn

rows.arabic: إِن نَّشَأْ نُنَزِّلْ عَلَيْهِم مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ ءَايَةً فَظَلَّتْ أَعْنَـٰقُهُمْ لَهَا خَـٰضِعِينَ
rows.translation: If We please, We should send down upon them a sign from the heaven so that their necks should stoop to it.
rows.transliteration: in nasha-nunazzil `alayhim minas samā-i āyatan faẓallat a`nāquhum lahā khāḍi`īn

rows.arabic: وَمَا يَأْتِيهِم مِّن ذِكْرٍ مِّنَ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ مُحْدَثٍ إِلَّا كَانُوا۟ عَنْهُ مُعْرِضِينَ
rows.translation: And there does not come to them a new reminder from the Beneficent Allah but they turn aside from it.
rows.transliteration: wa mā ya-tīhim min dhikrin minar raḥmāni muḥdathin illā kānū `anhu mu`riḍīn

rows.arabic: فَقَدْ كَذَّبُوا۟ فَسَيَأْتِيهِمْ أَنۢبَـٰٓؤُا۟ مَا كَانُوا۟ بِهِۦ يَسْتَهْزِءُونَ
rows.translation: So they have indeed rejected (the truth), therefore the news of that which they mock shall soon come to them.
rows.transliteration: faqad kadhhabū fasaya-tīhim anbā-u mā kānū bihi yastahzi-ūn

rows.arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا۟ إِلَى ٱلْأَرْضِ كَمْ أَنۢبَتْنَا فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ زَوْجٍ كَرِيمٍ
rows.translation: Do they not see the earth, how many of every noble kind We have caused to grow in it?
rows.transliteration: awalam yaraw ilal-arḍi kam anbatnā fīhā min kulli zawjin karīm

rows.arabic: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: Most surely there is a sign in that, but most of them will not believe.
rows.transliteration: inna fī dhālika la-āyah ۖ wa mā kāna aktharuhum mu-minīn

rows.translation: And most surely your Lord is the Mighty, the Merciful.

rows.arabic: وَإِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبُّكَ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنِ ٱئْتِ ٱلْقَوْمَ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
rows.translation: And when your Lord called out to Musa, saying: Go to the unjust people,
rows.transliteration: wa idh nādā rabbuka mūsā ani-til qawmaẓ ẓālimīn

rows.translation: The people of Firon: Will they not guard (against evil)?

rows.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّىٓ أَخَافُ أَن يُكَذِّبُونِ
rows.translation: He said: O my Lord! surely I fear that they will reject me;
rows.transliteration: qāla rabbi innī akhāfu an yukadhhibūn

rows.arabic: وَيَضِيقُ صَدْرِى وَلَا يَنطَلِقُ لِسَانِى فَأَرْسِلْ إِلَىٰ هَـٰرُونَ
rows.translation: And by breast straitens, and my tongue is not eloquent, therefore send Thou to Haroun (to help me);
rows.transliteration: wayaḍīqu ṣadrī walā yanṭaliqu lisānī fa-arsil ilā hārūn

rows.arabic: وَلَهُمْ عَلَىَّ ذَنۢبٌ فَأَخَافُ أَن يَقْتُلُونِ
rows.translation: And they have a crime against me, therefore I fear that they may slay me.

rows.arabic: قَالَ كَلَّا ۖ فَٱذْهَبَا بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَآ ۖ إِنَّا مَعَكُم مُّسْتَمِعُونَ
rows.translation: He said: By no means, so go you both with Our signs; surely We are with you, hearing;
rows.transliteration: qāla kallā ۖ fadh-habā bi-āyātinā ۖ innā ma`akum mustami`ūn

rows.arabic: فَأْتِيَا فِرْعَوْنَ فَقُولَآ إِنَّا رَسُولُ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
rows.translation: Then come to Firon and say: Surely we are the apostles of the Lord of the worlds:
rows.transliteration: fa-tiyā fir`awna faqūlā innā rasūlu rabbil `ālamīn

rows.translation: Then send with us the children of Israel.

rows.arabic: قَالَ أَلَمْ نُرَبِّكَ فِينَا وَلِيدًا وَلَبِثْتَ فِينَا مِنْ عُمُرِكَ سِنِينَ
rows.translation: (Firon) said: Did we not bring you up as a child among us, and you tarried among us for (many) years of your life?
rows.transliteration: qāla alam nurabbika fīnā walīdan walabithta fīnā min `umurika sinīn

rows.arabic: وَفَعَلْتَ فَعْلَتَكَ ٱلَّتِى فَعَلْتَ وَأَنتَ مِنَ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
rows.translation: And you did (that) deed of yours which you did, and you are one of the ungrateful.
rows.transliteration: wafa`alta fa`latakal latī fa`alta wa-anta minal kāfirīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ فَعَلْتُهَآ إِذًا وَأَنَا۠ مِنَ ٱلضَّآلِّينَ
rows.translation: He said: I did it then while I was of those unable to see the right course;
rows.transliteration: qāla fa`altuhā idhan wa-ana minaḍ ḍāllīn

rows.arabic: فَفَرَرْتُ مِنكُمْ لَمَّا خِفْتُكُمْ فَوَهَبَ لِى رَبِّى حُكْمًا وَجَعَلَنِى مِنَ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ
rows.translation: So I fled from you when I feared you, then my Lord granted me wisdom and made me of the apostles;
rows.transliteration: fafarartu minkum lammā khiftukum fawahaba lī rabbī ḥukman waja`alanī minal mursalīn

rows.arabic: وَتِلْكَ نِعْمَةٌ تَمُنُّهَا عَلَىَّ أَنْ عَبَّدتَّ بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ
rows.translation: And is it a favor of which you remind me that you have enslaved the children of Israel?
rows.transliteration: watilka ni`matun tamunnuhā `alayya an `abbadta banī isrā-iyl

rows.translation: Firon said: And what is the Lord of the worlds?

rows.arabic: قَالَ رَبُّ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَآ ۖ إِن كُنتُم مُّوقِنِينَ
rows.translation: He said: The Lord of the heavens and the earth and what is between them, if you would be sure.
rows.transliteration: qāla rabbus samāwāti wal-arḍi wa mā baynahumā ۖ in kuntum mūqinīn

rows.translation: (Firon) said to those around him: Do you not hear?
He said: Your Lord and the Lord of your fathers of old.

rows.arabic: قَالَ إِنَّ رَسُولَكُمُ ٱلَّذِىٓ أُرْسِلَ إِلَيْكُمْ لَمَجْنُونٌ
rows.translation: Said he: Most surely your Apostle who is sent to you is mad.
rows.transliteration: qāla inna rasūlakumul ladhī ursila ilaykum lamajnūn

rows.arabic: قَالَ رَبُّ ٱلْمَشْرِقِ وَٱلْمَغْرِبِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَآ ۖ إِن كُنتُمْ تَعْقِلُونَ
rows.translation: He said: The Lord of the east and the west and what is between them, if you understand.
rows.transliteration: qāla rabbul mashriqi wal maghribi wa mā baynahumā ۖ in kuntum ta`qilūn

rows.arabic: قَالَ لَئِنِ ٱتَّخَذْتَ إِلَـٰهًا غَيْرِى لَأَجْعَلَنَّكَ مِنَ ٱلْمَسْجُونِينَ
rows.translation: Said he: If you will take a god besides me, I will most certainly make you one of the imprisoned.
rows.transliteration: qāla la-init-takhadhta ilāhan ghayrī la-aj`alannaka minal masjūnīn

rows.translation: He said: What! even if I bring to you something manifest?

rows.arabic: قَالَ فَأْتِ بِهِۦٓ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰدِقِينَ
rows.translation: Said he: Bring it then, if you are of the truthful ones.
rows.transliteration: qāla fa-ti bihi in kunta minaṣ ṣādiqīn

rows.arabic: فَأَلْقَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِىَ ثُعْبَانٌ مُّبِينٌ
rows.translation: So he cast down his rod, and lo! it was an obvious serpent,

rows.arabic: وَنَزَعَ يَدَهُۥ فَإِذَا هِىَ بَيْضَآءُ لِلنَّـٰظِرِينَ
rows.translation: And he drew forth his hand, and lo! it appeared white to the onlookers.
rows.transliteration: wanaza`a yadahu fa-idhā hiya bayḍā-u linnāẓirīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ لِلْمَلَإِ حَوْلَهُۥٓ إِنَّ هَـٰذَا لَسَـٰحِرٌ عَلِيمٌ
rows.translation: (Firon) said to the chiefs around him: Most surely this is a skillful magician,
rows.transliteration: qāla lil-mala-i ḥawlahu inna hādhā lasāḥirun `alīm

rows.arabic: يُرِيدُ أَن يُخْرِجَكُم مِّنْ أَرْضِكُم بِسِحْرِهِۦ فَمَاذَا تَأْمُرُونَ
rows.translation: Who desires to turn you out of your land with his magic; what is it then that you advise?
rows.transliteration: yurīdu an yukhrijakum min arḍikum bisiḥrihi famādhā ta-murūn

rows.arabic: قَالُوٓا۟ أَرْجِهْ وَأَخَاهُ وَٱبْعَثْ فِى ٱلْمَدَآئِنِ حَـٰشِرِينَ
rows.translation: They said: Give him and his brother respite and send heralds into the cities
rows.transliteration: qālū arjih wa-akhāhu wab`ath fil madā-ini ḥāshirīn

rows.translation: That they should bring to you every skillful magician.
So the magicians were gathered together at the appointed time on the fixed day,
And it was said to the people: Will you gather together?

rows.arabic: لَعَلَّنَا نَتَّبِعُ ٱلسَّحَرَةَ إِن كَانُوا۟ هُمُ ٱلْغَـٰلِبِينَ
rows.translation: Haply we may follow the magicians, if they are the vanquishers.
rows.transliteration: la`allanā nattabi`us saḥarata in kānū humul ghālibīn

rows.arabic: فَلَمَّا جَآءَ ٱلسَّحَرَةُ قَالُوا۟ لِفِرْعَوْنَ أَئِنَّ لَنَا لَأَجْرًا إِن كُنَّا نَحْنُ ٱلْغَـٰلِبِينَ
rows.translation: And when the magicians came, they said to Firon: Shall we get a reward if we are the vanquishers?
rows.transliteration: falammā jā-as saḥaratu qālū lifir`awna a-inna lanā la-ajran in kunnā naḥnul ghālibīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ نَعَمْ وَإِنَّكُمْ إِذًا لَّمِنَ ٱلْمُقَرَّبِينَ
rows.translation: He said: Yes, and surely you will then be of those who are made near.
rows.transliteration: qāla na`am wa innakum idhal laminal muqarrabīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ لَهُم مُّوسَىٰٓ أَلْقُوا۟ مَآ أَنتُم مُّلْقُونَ
rows.translation: Musa said to them: Cast what you are going to cast.
rows.transliteration: qāla lahum mūsā alqū mā antum mulqūn

rows.arabic: فَأَلْقَوْا۟ حِبَالَهُمْ وَعِصِيَّهُمْ وَقَالُوا۟ بِعِزَّةِ فِرْعَوْنَ إِنَّا لَنَحْنُ ٱلْغَـٰلِبُونَ
rows.translation: So they cast down their cords and their rods and said: By Firon's power, we shall most surely be victorious.
rows.transliteration: fa-alqaw ḥibālahum wa`iṣiyyahum waqālū bi`izzati fir`awna innā lanaḥnul ghālibūn

rows.arabic: فَأَلْقَىٰ مُوسَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِىَ تَلْقَفُ مَا يَأْفِكُونَ
rows.translation: Then Musa cast down his staff and lo! it swallowed up the lies they told.
rows.transliteration: fa-alqā mūsā `aṣāhu fa-idhā hiya talqafu mā ya-fikūn

rows.translation: And the magicians were thrown down prostrate;
They said: We believe in the Lord of the worlds:
The Lord of Musa and Haroun.

rows.arabic: قَالَ ءَامَنتُمْ لَهُۥ قَبْلَ أَنْ ءَاذَنَ لَكُمْ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ لَكَبِيرُكُمُ ٱلَّذِى عَلَّمَكُمُ ٱلسِّحْرَ فَلَسَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ ۚ لَأُقَطِّعَنَّ أَيْدِيَكُمْ وَأَرْجُلَكُم مِّنْ خِلَـٰفٍ وَلَأُصَلِّبَنَّكُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
rows.translation: Said he: You believe in him before I give you permission; most surely he is the chief of you who taught you the magic, so you shall know: certainly I will cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, and certainly I will crucify you all.
rows.transliteration: qāla āmantum lahu qabla an ādhana lakum ۖ innahu lakabīrukumul ladhī `allamakumus siḥra falasawfa ta`lamūn ۚ la-uqaṭṭi`anna aydiyakum wa-arjulakum min khilāfin wala-uṣallibannakum ajma`īn

rows.arabic: قَالُوا۟ لَا ضَيْرَ ۖ إِنَّآ إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا مُنقَلِبُونَ
rows.translation: They said: No harm; surely to our Lord we go back;
rows.transliteration: qālū lā ḍayr ۖ innā ilā rabbinā munqalibūn

rows.arabic: إِنَّا نَطْمَعُ أَن يَغْفِرَ لَنَا رَبُّنَا خَطَـٰيَـٰنَآ أَن كُنَّآ أَوَّلَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: Surely we hope that our Lord will forgive us our wrongs because we are the first of the believers.
rows.transliteration: innā naṭma`u an yaghfira lanā rabbunā khaṭāyānā an kunnā awwalal-mu-minīn

rows.arabic: وَأَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنْ أَسْرِ بِعِبَادِىٓ إِنَّكُم مُّتَّبَعُونَ
rows.translation: And We revealed to Musa, saying: Go away with My servants travelling by night, surely you will be pursued.
rows.transliteration: wa-awḥaynā ilā mūsā an asri bi`ibādī innakum muttaba`ūn

rows.translation: So Firon sent heralds into the cities;
Most surely these are a small company;
And most surely they have enraged us;
And most surely we are a vigilant multitude.
So We turned them out of gardens and springs,
And treasures and goodly dwellings,
Even so. And We gave them as a heritage to the children of Israel.
Then they pursued them at sunrise.

rows.arabic: فَلَمَّا تَرَٰٓءَا ٱلْجَمْعَانِ قَالَ أَصْحَـٰبُ مُوسَىٰٓ إِنَّا لَمُدْرَكُونَ
rows.translation: So when the two hosts saw each other, the companions of Musa cried out: Most surely we are being overtaken.
rows.transliteration: falammā tarā al jam`āni qāla aṣ-ḥābu mūsā innā lamudrakūn

rows.arabic: قَالَ كَلَّآ ۖ إِنَّ مَعِىَ رَبِّى سَيَهْدِينِ
rows.translation: He said: By no means; surely my Lord is with me: He will show me a way out.
rows.transliteration: qāla kallā ۖ inna ma`iya rabbī sayahdīn

rows.arabic: فَأَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنِ ٱضْرِب بِّعَصَاكَ ٱلْبَحْرَ ۖ فَٱنفَلَقَ فَكَانَ كُلُّ فِرْقٍ كَٱلطَّوْدِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ
rows.translation: Then We revealed to Musa: Strike the sea with your staff. So it had cloven asunder, and each part was like a huge mound.
rows.transliteration: fa-awḥaynā ilā mūsā aniḍ-rib bi`aṣākal baḥr ۖ fanfalaqa fakāna kullu firqin kaṭ ṭawdil `aẓīm

rows.translation: And We brought near, there, the others.
And We saved Musa and those with him, all of them.
rows.transliteration: wa-anjaynā mūsā wa man ma`ahu ajma`īn

rows.translation: Then We drowned the others.

rows.arabic: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: Most surely there is a sign in this, but most of them do not believe.
rows.transliteration: inna fī dhālika la-āyah ۖ wa mā kāna aktharuhum mu-minīn

rows.translation: And most surely your Lord is the Mighty, the Merciful.
And recite to them the story of Ibrahim.

rows.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوْمِهِۦ مَا تَعْبُدُونَ
rows.translation: When he said to his father and his people: What do you worship?
rows.transliteration: idh qāla li-abīhi waqawmihi mā ta`budūn

rows.arabic: قَالُوا۟ نَعْبُدُ أَصْنَامًا فَنَظَلُّ لَهَا عَـٰكِفِينَ
rows.translation: They said: We worship idols, so we shall be their votaries.
He said: Do they hear you when you call?
Or do they profit you or cause you harm?

rows.arabic: قَالُوا۟ بَلْ وَجَدْنَآ ءَابَآءَنَا كَذَٰلِكَ يَفْعَلُونَ
rows.translation: They said: Nay, we found our fathers doing so.
rows.transliteration: qālū bal wajadnā ābā-anā kadhālika yaf`alūn

rows.translation: He said: Have you then considered what you have been worshipping:
rows.transliteration: qāla afara aytum mā kuntum ta`budūn

rows.translation: You and your ancient sires.

rows.arabic: فَإِنَّهُمْ عَدُوٌّ لِّىٓ إِلَّا رَبَّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
rows.translation: Surely they are enemies to me, but not (so) the Lord of the worlds;
Who created me, then He has shown me the way:
And He Who gives me to eat and gives me to drink:
And when I am sick, then He restores me to health
And He Who will cause me to die, then give me life;

rows.arabic: وَٱلَّذِىٓ أَطْمَعُ أَن يَغْفِرَ لِى خَطِيٓـَٔتِى يَوْمَ ٱلدِّينِ
rows.translation: And Who, I hope, will forgive me my mistakes on the day of judgment.
rows.transliteration: wal ladhī aṭma`u an yaghfira lī khaṭī-atī yawmad dīn

rows.arabic: رَبِّ هَبْ لِى حُكْمًا وَأَلْحِقْنِى بِٱلصَّـٰلِحِينَ
rows.translation: My Lord: Grant me wisdom, and join me with the good
rows.transliteration: rabbi hab lī ḥukman wa-alḥiqnī biṣ ṣāliḥīn

rows.arabic: وَٱجْعَل لِّى لِسَانَ صِدْقٍ فِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرِينَ
rows.translation: And ordain for me a goodly mention among posterity
And make me of the heirs of the garden of bliss

rows.arabic: وَٱغْفِرْ لِأَبِىٓ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلضَّآلِّينَ
rows.translation: And forgive my father, for surely he is of those who have gone astray;
rows.transliteration: waghfir li-abī innahu kāna minaḍ ḍāllīn

rows.translation: And disgrace me not on the day when they are raised

rows.arabic: يَوْمَ لَا يَنفَعُ مَالٌ وَلَا بَنُونَ
rows.translation: The day on which property will not avail, nor sons
rows.transliteration: yawma lā yanfa`u mālun walā banūn

rows.arabic: إِلَّا مَنْ أَتَى ٱللَّهَ بِقَلْبٍ سَلِيمٍ
rows.translation: Except him who comes to Allah with a heart free (from evil).
And the garden shall be brought near for those who guard (against evil),
And the hell shall be made manifest to the erring ones,

rows.arabic: وَقِيلَ لَهُمْ أَيْنَ مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْبُدُونَ
rows.translation: And it shall be said to them: Where are those that you used to worship;
rows.transliteration: waqīla lahum ayna mā kuntum ta`budūn

rows.arabic: مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ هَلْ يَنصُرُونَكُمْ أَوْ يَنتَصِرُونَ
rows.translation: Besides Allah? Can they help you or yet help themselves?
rows.transliteration: min dūnillāhi hal yanṣurūnakum aw yantaṣirūn

rows.translation: So they shall be thrown down into it, they and the erring ones,
And the hosts of the Shaitan, all.
They shall say while they contend therein:

rows.arabic: تَٱللَّهِ إِن كُنَّا لَفِى ضَلَـٰلٍ مُّبِينٍ
rows.translation: By Allah! we were certainly in manifest error,
rows.transliteration: tallāhi in kunnā lafī ḍalālin mubīn

rows.translation: When we made you equal to the Lord of the worlds;
And none but the guilty led us astray;
So we have no intercessors,
Nor a true friend;

rows.arabic: فَلَوْ أَنَّ لَنَا كَرَّةً فَنَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: But if we could but once return, we would be of the believers.
rows.transliteration: falaw anna lanā karratan fanakūna minal mu-minīn

rows.arabic: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: Most surely there is a sign in this, but most of them do not believe.
rows.transliteration: inna fī dhālika la-āyah ۖ wa mā kāna aktharuhum mu-minīn

rows.translation: And most surely your Lord is the Mighty, the Merciful.
The people of Nuh rejected the apostles.

rows.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ نُوحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
rows.translation: When their brother Nuh said to them: Will you not guard (against evil)?
rows.transliteration: idh qāla lahum akhūhum nūḥun alā tattaqūn

rows.translation: Surely I am a faithful apostle to you;
Therefore guard against (the punishment of) Allah and obey me

rows.arabic: وَمَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
rows.translation: And I do not ask you any reward for it; my reward is only with the Lord of the worlds:
rows.transliteration: wa mā as-alukum `alayhi min ajr ۖ in ajriya illā `alā rabbil `ālamīn

rows.translation: So guard against (the punishment of) Allah and obey me.
They said: Shall we believe in you while the meanest follow you?

rows.arabic: قَالَ وَمَا عِلْمِى بِمَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
rows.translation: He said: And what knowledge have I of what they do?
rows.transliteration: qāla wa mā `il-mī bimā kānū ya`malūn

rows.arabic: إِنْ حِسَابُهُمْ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّى ۖ لَوْ تَشْعُرُونَ
rows.translation: Their account is only with my Lord, if you could perceive
rows.transliteration: in ḥisābuhum illā `alā rabbī ۖ law tash`urūn

rows.translation: And I am not going to drive away the believers;
I am naught but a plain warner.

rows.arabic: قَالُوا۟ لَئِن لَّمْ تَنتَهِ يَـٰنُوحُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلْمَرْجُومِينَ
rows.translation: They said: If you desist not, O Nuh, you shall most certainly be of those stoned to death.
rows.transliteration: qālū la-in lam tantahi yānūḥu latakūnanna minal marjūmīn

rows.translation: He said: My Lord! Surely my people give me the lie!

rows.arabic: فَٱفْتَحْ بَيْنِى وَبَيْنَهُمْ فَتْحًا وَنَجِّنِى وَمَن مَّعِىَ مِنَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: Therefore judge Thou between me and them with a (just) judgment, and deliver me and those who are with me of the believers.
rows.transliteration: faftaḥ baynī wabaynahum fat-ḥan wanajjinī wa man ma`iya minal mu-minīn

rows.arabic: فَأَنجَيْنَـٰهُ وَمَن مَّعَهُۥ فِى ٱلْفُلْكِ ٱلْمَشْحُونِ
rows.translation: So We delivered him and those with him in the laden ark.
rows.transliteration: fa-anjaynāhu wa man ma`ahu fil fulkil mashḥūn

rows.translation: Then We drowned the rest afterwards

rows.arabic: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: Most surely there is a sign in this, but most of them do not believe.
rows.transliteration: inna fī dhālika la-āyah ۖ wa mā kāna aktharuhum mu-minīn

rows.translation: And most surely your Lord is the Mighty, the Merciful.
Ad gave the lie to the apostles.

rows.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ هُودٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
rows.translation: When their brother Hud said to them: Will you not guard (against evil)?
rows.transliteration: idh qāla lahum akhūhum hūdun alā tattaqūn

rows.translation: Surely I am a faithful apostle to you;
Therefore guard against (the punishment of) Allah and obey me:

rows.arabic: وَمَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
rows.translation: And I do not ask you any reward for it; surely my reward is only with the Lord of the worlds
rows.transliteration: wa mā as-alukum `alayhi min ajr ۖ in ajriya illā `alā rabbil `ālamīn

rows.translation: Do you build on every height a monument? Vain is it that you do:
And you make strong fortresses that perhaps you may
And when you lay hands (on men) you lay hands (like) tyrants;
So guard against (the punishment of) Allah and obey me
And be careful of (your duty to) Him Who has given you abundance of what you know.
He has given you abundance of cattle and children
And gardens and fountains;

rows.arabic: إِنِّىٓ أَخَافُ عَلَيْكُمْ عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
rows.translation: Surely I fear for you the chastisement of a grievous day

rows.arabic: قَالُوا۟ سَوَآءٌ عَلَيْنَآ أَوَعَظْتَ أَمْ لَمْ تَكُن مِّنَ ٱلْوَٰعِظِينَ
rows.translation: They said: It is the same to us whether you admonish or are not one of the admonishers
rows.transliteration: qālū sawā-un `alaynā awa`aẓta am lam takun minal wā`iẓīn

rows.translation: This is naught but a custom of the ancients;
And we are not going to be punished.

rows.arabic: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَهْلَكْنَـٰهُمْ ۗ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: So they gave him the lie, then We destroyed them. Most surely there is a sign in this, but most of them do not believe.
rows.transliteration: fakadhhabūhu fa-ahlaknāhum ۗ inna fī dhālika la-āyah ۖ wa mā kāna aktharuhum mu-minīn

rows.translation: And most surely your Lord is the Mighty, the Merciful.
Samood gave the lie to the apostles

rows.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ صَـٰلِحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
rows.translation: When their brother Salih said to them: Will you not guard (against evil)?
rows.transliteration: idh qāla lahum akhūhum ṣāliḥun alā tattaqūn

rows.translation: Surely I am a faithful apostle to you
Therefore guard against (the punishment of) Allah and obey me:

rows.arabic: وَمَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
rows.translation: And I do not ask you any reward for it; my reward is only with the Lord of the worlds:
rows.transliteration: wa mā as-alukum `alayhi min ajr ۖ in ajriya illā `alā rabbil `ālamīn

rows.translation: Will you be left secure in what is here;
In gardens and fountains,
And cornfields and palm-trees having fine spadices?
And you hew houses out of the mountains exultingly;
Therefore guard against (the punishment of) Allah and obey me;
And do not obey the bidding of the extravagant,

rows.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يُفْسِدُونَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَا يُصْلِحُونَ
rows.translation: Who make mischief in the land and do not act aright.
They said: You are only of the deluded ones;

rows.arabic: مَآ أَنتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِّثْلُنَا فَأْتِ بِـَٔايَةٍ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰدِقِينَ
rows.translation: You are naught but a mortal like ourselves; so bring a sign if you are one of the truthful.
rows.transliteration: mā anta illā basharun mithlunā fa-ti bi-āyatin in kunta minaṣ ṣādiqīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ هَـٰذِهِۦ نَاقَةٌ لَّهَا شِرْبٌ وَلَكُمْ شِرْبُ يَوْمٍ مَّعْلُومٍ
rows.translation: He said: This is a she-camel; she shall have her portion of water, and you have your portion of water on an appointed time;
rows.transliteration: qāla hādhihi nāqatun lahā shirbun walakum shirbu yawmin ma`lūm

rows.arabic: وَلَا تَمَسُّوهَا بِسُوٓءٍ فَيَأْخُذَكُمْ عَذَابُ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
rows.translation: And do not touch her with evil, lest the punishment of a grievous day should overtake you.
But they hamstrung her, then regretted;

rows.arabic: فَأَخَذَهُمُ ٱلْعَذَابُ ۗ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: So the punishment overtook them. Most surely there is a sign in this, but most of them do not believe.
rows.transliteration: fa-akhadhahumul `adhāb ۗ inna fī dhālika la-āyah ۖ wa mā kāna aktharuhum mu-minīn

rows.translation: And most surely your Lord is the Mighty, the Merciful.
The people of Lut gave the lie to the apostles.

rows.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ لُوطٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
rows.translation: When their brother Lut said to them: Will you not guard (against evil)?
rows.transliteration: idh qāla lahum akhūhum lūṭun alā tattaqūn

rows.translation: Surely I am a faithful apostle to you;
Therefore guard against (the punishment of) Allah and obey me:

rows.arabic: وَمَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
rows.translation: And I do not ask you any reward for it; my reward is only with the Lord of the worlds;
rows.transliteration: wa mā as-alukum `alayhi min ajr ۖ in ajriya illā `alā rabbil `ālamīn

rows.translation: What! do you come to the males from among the creatures

rows.arabic: وَتَذَرُونَ مَا خَلَقَ لَكُمْ رَبُّكُم مِّنْ أَزْوَٰجِكُم ۚ بَلْ أَنتُمْ قَوْمٌ عَادُونَ
rows.translation: And leave what your Lord has created for you of your wives? Nay, you are a people exceeding limits.
rows.transliteration: watadharūna mā khalaqa lakum rabbukum min azwājikum ۚ bal antum qawmun `ādūn

rows.arabic: قَالُوا۟ لَئِن لَّمْ تَنتَهِ يَـٰلُوطُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلْمُخْرَجِينَ
rows.translation: They said: If you desist not, O Lut! you shall surely be of those who are expelled.
rows.transliteration: qālū la-in lam tantahi yālūṭu latakūnanna minal mukhrajīn

rows.translation: He said: Surely I am of those who utterly abhor your doing;
My Lord! deliver me and my followers from what they do.
So We delivered him and his followers all,
Except an old woman, among those who remained behind.
Then We utterly destroyed the others.

rows.arabic: وَأَمْطَرْنَا عَلَيْهِم مَّطَرًا ۖ فَسَآءَ مَطَرُ ٱلْمُنذَرِينَ
rows.translation: And We rained down upon them a rain, and evil was the rain on those warned.

rows.arabic: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: Most surely there is a sign in this, but most of them do not believe.
rows.transliteration: inna fī dhālika la-āyah ۖ wa mā kāna aktharuhum mu-minīn

rows.translation: And most surely your Lord is the Mighty, the Merciful.
The dwellers of the thicket gave the lie to the apostles.

rows.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ شُعَيْبٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
rows.translation: When Shu'aib said to them: Will you not guard (against evil)?
rows.transliteration: idh qāla lahum shu`aybun alā tattaqūn

rows.translation: Surely I am a faithful apostle to you;
Therefore guard against (the punishment of) Allah and obey me:

rows.arabic: وَمَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
rows.translation: And I do not ask you any reward for it, my reward is only with the Lord of the worlds;
rows.transliteration: wa mā as-alukum `alayhi min ajr ۖ in ajriya illā `alā rabbil `ālamīn

rows.arabic: أَوْفُوا۟ ٱلْكَيْلَ وَلَا تَكُونُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلْمُخْسِرِينَ
rows.translation: Give a full measure and be not of those who diminish;
rows.transliteration: awful kayla walā takūnū minal mukhsirīn

rows.translation: And weigh (things) with a right balance,

rows.arabic: وَلَا تَبْخَسُوا۟ ٱلنَّاسَ أَشْيَآءَهُمْ وَلَا تَعْثَوْا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ مُفْسِدِينَ
rows.translation: And do not wrong men of their things, and do not act corruptly in the earth, making mischief.
rows.transliteration: walā tabkhasun nāsa ashyā-ahum walā ta`thaw fil-arḍi mufsidīn

rows.translation: And guard against (the punishment of) Him who created you and the former nations.
They said: You are only of those deluded;

rows.arabic: وَمَآ أَنتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِّثْلُنَا وَإِن نَّظُنُّكَ لَمِنَ ٱلْكَـٰذِبِينَ
rows.translation: And you are naught but a mortal like ourselves, and we know you to be certainly of the liars.
rows.transliteration: wa mā anta illā basharun mithlunā wa in naẓunnuka laminal kādhibīn

rows.arabic: فَأَسْقِطْ عَلَيْنَا كِسَفًا مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰدِقِينَ
rows.translation: Therefore cause a portion of the heaven to come down upon us, if you are one of the truthful.
rows.transliteration: fa-asqiṭ `alaynā kisafan minas samā-i in kunta minaṣ ṣādiqīn

rows.translation: He said: My Lord knows best what you do.

rows.arabic: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَخَذَهُمْ عَذَابُ يَوْمِ ٱلظُّلَّةِ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
rows.translation: But they called him a liar, so the punishment of the day of covering overtook them; surely it was the punishment of a grievous day.
rows.transliteration: fakadhhabūhu fa-akhadhahum `adhābu yawmiẓ ẓullah ۚ innahu kāna `adhāba yawmin `aẓīm

rows.arabic: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: Most surely there is a sign in this, but most of them do not believe.
rows.transliteration: inna fī dhālika la-āyah ۖ wa mā kāna aktharuhum mu-minīn

rows.translation: And most surely your Lord is Mighty, the Merciful.
And most surely this is a revelation from the Lord of the worlds.
The Faithful Spirit has descended with it,
Upon your heart that you may be of the warners
In plain Arabic language.
And most surely the same is in the scriptures of the ancients.

rows.arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَكُن لَّهُمْ ءَايَةً أَن يَعْلَمَهُۥ عُلَمَـٰٓؤُا۟ بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ
rows.translation: Is it not a sign to them that the learned men of the Israelites know it?
rows.transliteration: awalam yakun lahum āyatan an ya`lamahu `ulamā-u banī isrā-iyl

rows.translation: And if we had revealed it to any of the foreigners

rows.arabic: فَقَرَأَهُۥ عَلَيْهِم مَّا كَانُوا۟ بِهِۦ مُؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: So that he should have recited it to them, they would not have believed therein.
Thus have We caused it to enter into the hearts of the guilty.

rows.arabic: لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِهِۦ حَتَّىٰ يَرَوُا۟ ٱلْعَذَابَ ٱلْأَلِيمَ
rows.translation: They will not believe in it until they see the painful punishment.
And it shall come to them all of a sudden, while they shall not perceive;
Then they will say: Shall we be respited?
What! do they still seek to hasten on Our punishment?
Have you then considered if We let them enjoy themselves for years,
Then there comes to them that with which they are threatened,

rows.arabic: مَآ أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا۟ يُمَتَّعُونَ
rows.translation: That which they were made to enjoy shall not avail them?

rows.arabic: وَمَآ أَهْلَكْنَا مِن قَرْيَةٍ إِلَّا لَهَا مُنذِرُونَ
rows.translation: And We did not destroy any town but it had (its) warners,
rows.transliteration: wa mā ahlaknā min qaryatin illā lahā mundhirūn

rows.translation: To remind, and We are never unjust.
And the Shaitans have not come down with it.
And it behoves them not, and they have not the power to do (it).
rows.transliteration: wa mā yanbaghī lahum wa mā yastaṭī`ūn

rows.translation: Most surely they are far removed from the hearing of it.

rows.arabic: فَلَا تَدْعُ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَـٰهًا ءَاخَرَ فَتَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْمُعَذَّبِينَ
rows.translation: So call not upon another god with Allah, lest you be of those who are punished.
rows.transliteration: falā tad`u ma`allāhi ilāhan ākhara fatakūna minal mu`adhhabīn

rows.translation: And warn your nearest relations,

rows.arabic: وَٱخْفِضْ جَنَاحَكَ لِمَنِ ٱتَّبَعَكَ مِنَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: And be kind to him who follows you of the believers.

rows.arabic: فَإِنْ عَصَوْكَ فَقُلْ إِنِّى بَرِىٓءٌ مِّمَّا تَعْمَلُونَ
rows.translation: But if they disobey you, then say: Surely I am clear of what you do.
rows.transliteration: fa-in `aṣawka faqul innī barī-un mimmā ta`malūn

rows.translation: And rely on the Mighty, the Merciful,
Who sees you when you stand up.
And your turning over and over among those who prostrate themselves before Allah.
Surely He is the Hearing, the Knowing.

rows.arabic: هَلْ أُنَبِّئُكُمْ عَلَىٰ مَن تَنَزَّلُ ٱلشَّيَـٰطِينُ
rows.translation: Shall I inform you (of him) upon whom the Shaitans descend?
They descend upon every lying, sinful one,
They incline their ears, and most of them are liars.
And as to the poets, those who go astray follow them.

rows.arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّهُمْ فِى كُلِّ وَادٍ يَهِيمُونَ
rows.translation: Do you not see that they wander about bewildered in every valley?
rows.transliteration: alam tara annahum fī kulli wādiy yahīmūn

rows.translation: And that they say that which they do not do,

rows.arabic: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ وَذَكَرُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ كَثِيرًا وَٱنتَصَرُوا۟ مِنۢ بَعْدِ مَا ظُلِمُوا۟ ۗ وَسَيَعْلَمُ ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوٓا۟ أَىَّ مُنقَلَبٍ يَنقَلِبُونَ
rows.translation: Except those who believe and do good and remember Allah much, and defend themselves after they are oppressed; and they who act unjustly shall know to what final place of turning they shall turn back.
rows.transliteration: illal ladhīna āmanū wa`amiluṣ ṣāliḥāti wadhakarullāha kathīran wantaṣarū min ba`di mā ẓulimū ۗ wasaya`lamul ladhīna ẓalamū ayya munqalabiy yanqalibūn
